description: Commercial sound reinforcement, paging, and mass notification systems

questions.question: What is a 70V distributed audio system?
options: System using step-up transformers to distribute audio over long distances
questions.explanation: 70V (or 70.7V) distributed systems use transformers to step up amplifier output for efficient long-distance distribution.

questions.question: What is the advantage of a 70V audio system over low-impedance?
options: Lower wire gauge required and less power loss over distance
questions.explanation: 70V systems allow use of smaller wire gauges and experience less power loss over long cable runs.

questions.question: What is a paging system?
options: System for making voice announcements throughout a facility
questions.explanation: Paging systems allow voice announcements to be made over loudspeakers throughout a building or facility.

questions.question: What is a paging zone?
options: Group of speakers that can be addressed independently
questions.explanation: A zone is a group of speakers that can be selected for paging independently from other areas.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a mixer in a sound system?
options: Combine and control multiple audio sources
questions.explanation: A mixer combines multiple audio inputs (microphones, music sources) and controls levels before amplification.

questions.question: What wire type is commonly used for 70V speaker lines?
questions.explanation: Stranded two-conductor speaker wire, typically 16-18 AWG, is used for 70V distributed audio systems.

questions.question: What is the tap setting on a 70V speaker?
options: Wattage selection determining speaker volume relative to others
questions.explanation: Tap settings (wattage) on 70V speaker transformers determine how much power each speaker draws from the line.

questions.question: What happens if total speaker wattage exceeds amplifier rating?
options: Amplifier overloads and may clip or shut down
questions.explanation: Overloading an amplifier causes distortion (clipping), overheating, and possible shutdown or damage.

questions.question: What NEC article covers audio system wiring?
options: Article 640 Audio Signal Processing, Amplification, and Reproduction Equipment
questions.explanation: NEC Article 640 covers audio signal processing, amplification, and reproduction equipment including wiring.

questions.question: What is an all-call in paging systems?
questions.explanation: All-call allows an announcement to be made to all paging zones at once throughout the facility.

questions.question: What is speaker coverage pattern?
options: Area where sound from a speaker is adequately audible
questions.explanation: Coverage pattern describes the area where a speaker provides adequate sound level, determined by dispersion angle.

questions.question: What is a horn speaker typically used for?
options: High-output paging in noisy or outdoor environments
questions.explanation: Horn speakers provide high output and directional coverage for noisy industrial areas or outdoor paging.

questions.question: How is speaker placement calculated for ceiling speakers?
options: Based on coverage angle and ceiling height for overlapping coverage
questions.explanation: Speaker spacing is calculated using coverage angle and ceiling height to achieve overlapping coverage patterns.

questions.question: What is a line-level audio signal?
options: Standardized signal level between audio components (typically -10dBV to +4dBu)
questions.explanation: Line-level is a standardized signal level used between audio components like mixers, processors, and amplifiers.

questions.question: What is the difference between balanced and unbalanced audio?
options: Balanced uses three conductors with noise rejection; unbalanced uses two
questions.explanation: Balanced audio uses three conductors (+, -, ground) with common-mode rejection for noise immunity.

questions.question: What is priority override in paging systems?
options: Higher priority sources (emergency) automatically override lower priority audio
questions.explanation: Priority override allows emergency or important announcements to interrupt background music or other audio.

questions.question: What is a DSP in audio systems?
options: Digital Signal Processor for audio routing, EQ, and processing
questions.explanation: DSP (Digital Signal Processor) provides digital audio routing, equalization, delay, and other processing.

questions.question: What is AEC in audio conferencing?
options: Acoustic Echo Cancellation - removes echo from speaker to microphone
questions.explanation: AEC removes echo caused by audio from speakers being picked up by microphones in the same room.

questions.question: What is the purpose of equalization (EQ) in sound systems?
options: Adjust frequency response to compensate for room acoustics or preference
questions.explanation: EQ adjusts the frequency response to compensate for room acoustics, speaker characteristics, or tonal preference.

questions.question: What is ambient noise compensation?
options: Automatic volume adjustment based on background noise level
questions.explanation: Ambient noise compensation uses sensors to automatically adjust paging volume based on background noise.

questions.question: What is Dante in audio systems?
options: Digital audio networking protocol over standard Ethernet
questions.explanation: Dante is a digital audio networking protocol that transmits uncompressed audio over standard Ethernet networks.

questions.question: What is an audio matrix?
options: System allowing any input to be routed to any output or combination
questions.explanation: An audio matrix allows flexible routing of any audio input to any output or combination of outputs.

questions.question: What is feedback in sound systems?
options: Howling/squealing from microphone picking up its own amplified sound
questions.explanation: Feedback occurs when amplified sound from speakers is picked up by a microphone, creating a loop.

questions.question: What is a mass notification system (MNS)?
options: System for emergency announcements reaching all building occupants
questions.explanation: MNS provides emergency notifications (voice, text, visual) to all occupants during emergencies.

questions.question: What is required for paging system intelligibility?
options: STI (Speech Transmission Index) of 0.50 or greater typical
questions.explanation: Speech intelligibility requires adequate STI rating (0.50+ typical) ensuring announcements can be understood.

questions.question: What is speaker impedance matching?
options: Ensuring amplifier output impedance works properly with speaker load
questions.explanation: Impedance matching ensures the amplifier output impedance is compatible with the total speaker load.

questions.question: What is the function of a compressor/limiter in audio systems?
options: Control dynamic range and prevent overloading/clipping
questions.explanation: Compressors/limiters control audio dynamic range and prevent speaker/amplifier damage from excessive levels.

questions.question: What is EASE or CATT-Acoustic?
options: Room acoustics modeling software for sound system design
questions.explanation: EASE and CATT-Acoustic are software tools for modeling room acoustics and predicting sound system performance.

questions.question: What is beam steering in speaker arrays?
options: Electronic control of vertical coverage pattern using DSP and phased arrays
questions.explanation: Beam steering uses DSP to electronically control the vertical coverage pattern of column speakers.

questions.question: What is reverberation time (RT60)?
options: Time for sound to decay 60dB after source stops
questions.explanation: RT60 is the time required for sound to decay 60dB after the source stops, indicating room reverberance.

questions.question: What is the relationship between RT60 and intelligibility?
questions.explanation: Excessive reverberation (high RT60) causes speech to blur and overlap, reducing intelligibility.

questions.question: What is AES67 in audio networking?
questions.explanation: AES67 provides interoperability between different audio-over-IP protocols like Dante, Ravenna, and Livewire.

questions.question: How do you calculate total power for a 70V speaker run?
options: Sum all tap settings; ensure total does not exceed amplifier rating
questions.explanation: Total power draw is the sum of all speaker tap settings; amplifier must be rated at or above this total.

questions.question: What is required for mass notification audio intelligibility per NFPA 72?
options: Minimum STI of 0.50 or CIS of 0.70 for emergency voice/alarm
questions.explanation: NFPA 72 requires STI of 0.50 minimum or CIS of 0.70 for emergency voice/alarm communication.

questions.question: What is direct/reverberant field ratio and why does it matter?
options: Ratio of direct sound to reflected sound affecting intelligibility
questions.explanation: Higher direct-to-reverberant ratio improves intelligibility by ensuring direct sound dominates over reflections.
